channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog poo bag by tree stump, 25th January
item.description:
Black dog poo bag at tree base (the tree stump) Westbury road on odd side of pavement quite close to Croydon road, thanks

item.title: Metal cover pavement level - *UNSAFE*, 25th January
item.description:
The metal utilies (?) cover is raised above pavement level on an already cracked path, posing a trip hazard. My son fell and smashed his knee on to the exposed metal during which he sustained a very uncomfortable knee injury. Requesting discussing with the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Malmains Way, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rubbish under the trees since 3 weeks., 25th January
item.description:
When entering Owen Close , there is a heap of rubbish under the second tree by the left and more between the second and 3rd tree. And also under the tree in front of house number 18 which has been there for almost 3months. I personally put no dumping of rubbish notice there but they don’t care. The drive ways with “no parking “notices not owned by anyone are full of dead leaves rubbish not being swept by the street cleaners. Please kindly act as these are making the street so untidy. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Owen Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Setchell Way, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: 2 grey bin bags of stuff wedged in between the the road name post' Macoma Terrace' out side my front wall, i thought it may be the councils road sweepings ready to be picked up but its still there after several weeks., 25th January
item.description:
2 grey bin bags full, underneath road name " Macoma Terrace" outside my front garden wall . {no 18 Macoma Terrace, been there weeks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Macoma Terrace, Plumstead

item.title: 20-30m long slit running along lane been there for at least 3 months, 25th January
item.description:
The road has 'split' in two places, each is at least 10m long, both in the middle of the lane means that motorcylyist have to move to side of lane for a ling stretch making it dangerous for them and potentially confusing drivers behind who may think they are turning or pulling over
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Flooding to road, 25th January
item.description:
The attached photo was not taken during a rain shower. When it rains the road floods on both sides. Pedestrians get drowned when traffic passes and also when crossing the road.
